description: a(n) = smallest pseudoprime to base 2 with n prime factors.
comments: Smallest composite number m with n prime factors such that 2^(m-1)-1 is divisible by m.
references: N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
links: R. Pinch, Pseudoprimes up to 10^13, Proceedings ANTS-IV, 4th Algorithmic Number Theory Symposium, Leiden, 2000. Springer Lecture Notes in Computer Science 1838 (2000) 459--474.
Index entries for sequences related to pseudoprimes
author: _Richard Pinch_
extensions: More terms from Herman Jamke (hermanjamke(AT)fastmail.fm), May 05 2007
